children.name: authCredential
children.text: Object
children.text2: Optional. Include this parameter to update an existing AuthCredential object.

children.name: AuthCredential(Object authCredential)
children.text: Instantiates a new AuthCredential object, or modifies an existing one.
children.text2: You can create an empty AuthCredential object, instantiate an existing AuthCredential object, or use the StandardCredentialsProvider class to instantiate an AuthCredential object using a Credential record from the Credentials [discovery_credentials] table. If you create an empty AuthCredential object, use the setAttribute() method to add properties to the object.

children.name: key
children.text: String
children.text2: Key of the attribute to return the value for. If you created an empty AuthCredential object, you must use the setAttribute() method to add properties to the object. If you used a credential record to instantiate the AuthCredential object, pass a field name from the Credential [discovery_credentials] table to access the value.

children.name: Example
children.text: // Define the HttpRequestData object var endpoint= "https://third-party-endpoint"; var httpRequestData = new sn_auth.HttpRequestData(); httpRequestData.setEndpoint(endpoint); httpRequestData.setService(‘s3’); httpRequestData.setRegion(‘us-east-1’); httpRequestData.setHttpMethod(“PUT”); var content = “Action=SendMessage&MessageBody=This is a test message”; httpRequestData.setContent(content); httpRequestData.addHeader(‘x-amz-acl’ , ‘public-read’ ); // Get AuthCredential object and set an attribute var credential = new sn_auth.AuthCredential(); credential.setAttribute("user_name", "admin"); // Sign the request and return an AuthCredential attribute value var signingAPI = new sn_auth.RequestAuthAPI(httpRequestData, credential); var signingCredential = signingAPI.getAuthCredential(); name = signingCredential.getAttribute("name");

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: getAttribute(String key)
children.text: Returns the value of an AuthCredential attribute.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: key
children.text: String
children.text2: Name of the attribute to set. If you created an empty AuthCredential object, you must use the this method to add properties to the object. If you used a credential record to instantiate the AuthCredential object, pass a field name from the Credential [discovery_credentials] table to set the value.

children.name: Example
children.text: // Define the HttpRequestData object var endpoint= "https://third-party-endpoint"; var httpRequestData = new sn_auth.HttpRequestData(); httpRequestData.setEndpoint(endpoint); httpRequestData.setService(‘s3’); httpRequestData.setRegion(‘us-east-1’); httpRequestData.setHttpMethod(“PUT”); var content = “Action=SendMessage&MessageBody=This is a test message”; httpRequestData.setContent(content); httpRequestData.addHeader(‘x-amz-acl’ , ‘public-read’ ); // Get AuthCredential object and set an attribute var credential = new sn_auth.AuthCredential(); credential.setAttribute("user_name", "admin");

children.name: value
children.text: String
children.text2: Value of the attribute.

children.name: setAttribute(String key, String value)
children.text: Sets an attribute for an AuthCredential object.

name: AuthCredential
text: The AuthCredential() API provides methods that enable you to build credentials for a REST request.
text2:
Generate outbound signing requests using these APIs in the following order:
  1. HttpRequestData: Build the API request.
  2. AuthCredential: Create a credential object or update an existing one. Use the credential to sign the request through the RequestAuthAPI class.
  3. RequestAuthAPI: Sign the request and return an HttpRequestAuthedData object.
  4. HttpRequestAuthedData: Get information about the signed request.
  5. GlideHTTPRequest: Send the signed request.


Before using these APIs, you must configure an authentication algorithm to sign the request and associate it with the credential used to authenticate the request.

You can create an empty AuthCredential object, instantiate an existing AuthCredential object, or use the StandardCredentialsProvider class to instantiate an AuthCredential object using a Credential record from the Credentials [discovery_credentials] table. If you create an empty AuthCredential object, use the setAttribute() method to add properties to the object.

See the following example to instantiate an AuthCredential using StandardCredentialsProvider:
// Return an AuthCredential object using a Credential sys_id
var credential = new sn_cc.StandardCredentialsProvider().getAuthCredentialByID("5b61c16f73533300f662cff8faf6a74b");


Use the AuthCredential API in scoped scripts with the sn_auth namespace identifier.

children.name: GlideOAuthToken
children.text: The access and refresh tokens for the client.

children.name: requestID
children.text: String
children.text2:
Request ID from the OAuth Requestor Profile [oauth_requestor_profile] table,
                which references the OAuth Entity Profile [oauth_entity_profile] table.

children.name: Output
children.text:
*** Script: AccessToken:6MRxD3TRYYvIaoKr-JCy3KiaOxBPu4C9k8oafo3MYf9q8zDyHQr8UzMSM3Md2alfaES1rzSYe5ydqgbOwpm7TA
*** Script: AccessTokenExpiresIn:1207
*** Script: RefreshToken:sc0iTK-0PcVkRi14HXPM3vT0FyOPO8iCqC10huQoDSSLBGUSnmEv_fUfJzGWCWBb_StsXIOz6r8qF-hRhURWTA

children.name: Example
children.text: function dumpToken(token) { if(token) { gs.info("AccessToken:" + token.getAccessToken()); gs.info("AccessTokenExpiresIn:" + token.getExpiresIn()); gs.info("RefreshToken:" + token.getRefreshToken()); } } var oAuthClient = new sn_auth.GlideOAuthClient(); var token = oAuthClient.getToken('248e3017c302301089a7dd5c2840dda5', '9c4e78d3c302301089a7dd5c2840dd76'); dumpToken(token);
children.text2:
This  code shows how to retrieve access and refresh tokens from the instance
        database.

children.name: oauthProfileID
children.text: String
children.text2:
OAuth profile ID from the OAuth Entity Profile [oauth_entity_profile]
                table.

children.name: getToken(String requestID, String oauthProfileID)
children.text: Retrieves the access and refresh tokens for the client.

children.name: GlideOAuthClientResponse
children.text: The token for the client.

children.name: clientName
children.text: String
children.text2: The client name.

children.name: Example
children.text: var oAuthClient = new GlideOAuthClient(); var params ={grant_type:"password", username:"itil", password:'itil'}; var json =new JSON(); var text = json.encode(params); var tokenResponse = oAuthClient.requestToken('TestClient', text); var token = tokenResponse.getToken(); gs.log("AccessToken:"+ token.getAccessToken()); gs.log("AccessTokenExpiresIn:"+ token.getExpiresIn()); gs.log(" RefreshToken:"+ token.getRefreshToken());
children.text2:
This  shows a resource owner password grant type request, with request parameters
        encoded in JSON format.

children.name: jsonString
children.text: String
children.text2: The JSON string for the client.

children.name: requestToken(String clientName, String jsonString)
children.text:
Retrieves the token for the client, with the request parameters encoded in JSON
    format.

children.text2: The client name.

Retrieves the token for the client, with the client name and the request set into a
    GlideOAuthClientResponse object.

children.text2: The client name.

children.name: revokeToken(String clientName, String accessToken, String refreshToken, GlideOAuthClientRequest request)
children.text:
Revokes the access or refresh token for the client, with the request and optional
    header parameters set into a GlideOAuthClientRequest object.

name: GlideOAuthClient - Scoped, Global
text: Use these methods for requesting and revoking OAuth refresh and access tokens.
text2: This API can be used in global and scoped scripts. In scoped scripts us the sn_auth namespace identifier.

children.name: Example
children.text: var tokenRequest =new GlideOAuthClientRequest(); tokenRequest.setGrantType("password"); tokenRequest.setUserName("itil"); tokenRequest.setPassword("itil"); tokenRequest.setScope(null); var oAuthClient =new GlideOAuthClient();var tokenResponse = oAuthClient.requestToken("TestClient", tokenRequest); gs.log("Error:"+ tokenResponse.getErrorMessage()); var token = tokenResponse.getToken();if(token){ gs.log("AccessToken:"+ token.getAccessToken()); gs.log("AccessTokenExpiresIn:"+ token.getExpiresIn()); gs.log("RefreshToken:"+ token.getRefreshToken());

name: GlideOAuthClientRequest - Scoped, Global
text: Use these methods for handling OAuth client requests.
text2: This API can be used in global and scoped scripts. In scoped scripts us the sn_auth namespace identifier.

children.name: String
children.text: The response information.

children.name: getBody()
children.text: Retrieves all of the response information, including instance information.

children.name: String
children.text: The HTTP response header.

children.name: getContentType()
children.text: Retrieves the HTTP response content header from an external OAuth provider.

children.name: String
children.text: The error message.

children.name: getErrorMessage()
children.text: Retrieves the error message if authentication is not successful.

children.name: String

children.text: Retrieves the error message if authentication is not successful.

children.text: Refreshes the token associated with the GlideOAuthToken object.

children.name: getScope()
children.text:
Retrieves the token scope, which is the amount of access granted by the access
    token.

name: GlideOAuthToken - Scoped, Global
text: Use the GlideOAuthToken methods for retrieving OAuth access token and information about the access token.
text2: This API can be used in global and scoped scripts. In scoped scripts use the sn_auth namespace identifier.

children.name: HttpRequestAuthedData()
children.text: Instantiates an HttpRequestAuthedData object.
children.text2: You can instantiate this class using the constructor, or you can return an HttpRequestAuthedData object from the generateAuth() method in the RequestAuthAPI class.

children.name: key
children.text: String
children.text2: Name of the HTTP header.

children.name: Example
children.text: // Define HttpRequestData var endpoint= "https://third-party-endpoint“; var httpRequestData = new sn_auth.HttpRequestData(); httpRequestData.setEndpoint(endpoint); httpRequestData.setService(‘s3’); httpRequestData.setRegion(‘us-east-1’); httpRequestData.setHttpMethod(“PUT”); var content = “Action=SendMessage&MessageBody=This is a test message”; httpRequestData.setContent(content); //Get AuthCredential var credential = new sn_cc.StandardCredentialsProvider().getAuthCredentialByID("5b61c16f73533300f662cff8faf6a74b"); // Create RequestAuthAPI and sign the request var signingAPI = new sn_auth.RequestAuthAPI(httpRequestData, credential); var output = signingAPI.generateAuth(); // Update the signed response output.addHeader(‘access-rights’, ‘public-read’);

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: value
children.text: String
children.text2: Value of the HTTP Header.

children.name: addHeader(String key, String value)
children.text: Adds a header to the HttpRequestAuthedData object.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: Example
children.text: // Define HttpRequestData var endpoint= "https://third-party-endpoint“; var httpRequestData = new sn_auth.HttpRequestData(); httpRequestData.setEndpoint(endpoint); httpRequestData.setService(‘s3’); httpRequestData.setRegion(‘us-east-1’); httpRequestData.setHttpMethod(“PUT”); var content = “Action=SendMessage&MessageBody=This is a test message”; httpRequestData.setContent(content); //Get AuthCredential var credential = new sn_cc.StandardCredentialsProvider().getAuthCredentialByID("5b61c16f73533300f662cff8faf6a74b"); // Create RequestAuthAPI and sign the request var signingAPI = new sn_auth.RequestAuthAPI(httpRequestData, credential); var output = signingAPI.generateAuth(); // Update the signed response output.addQueryParameter(‘api_version’, ‘v2’);

children.name: key
children.text: String
children.text2: Name of the query parameter.

children.name: value
children.text: String
children.text2: Value of the query parameter.

children.name: addQueryParam(String key, String value)
children.text: Adds a query parameter to the HttpRequestAuthedData object.

children.name: String
children.text: Text of the credential value.

children.name: Output
children.text: The Credential Value is someUsername:somePassword

children.name: Example
children.text: var RequestAuthGCISigner = Class.create(); RequestAuthGCISigner.prototype = Object.extend(new RequestAuthInternal(), { initialize: function() { RequestAuthInternal.prototype.initialize.call(this); }, generateAuth: function(authAPI) { var requestData = authAPI.getHttpRequestData(); // get credentials var credential = authAPI.getAuthCredential(); var username = credential.getAttribute("user_name"); var password = credential.getAttribute("password"); var httpRequestSignedData = new sn_auth.HttpRequestAuthedData(); var directive = requestData.getDirective(); // set CREDENTIAL_VALUE httpRequestSignedData.setCredentialValue(username+":"+password); httpRequestSignedData.setDirective("CREDENTIAL_VALUE"); httpRequestSignedData.setStatus("SUCCESS"); gs.info("The Credential Value is " + httpRequestSignedData.getCredentialValue()); return httpRequestSignedData; }, type: 'RequestAuthGCISigner' });
children.text2: This  shows the retrieval of a credential value.

children.name: getCredentialValue()
children.text: Returns the credential value that was included when the request was signed.
children.text2: Use a credential value to store a cookie, signature, or other value needed for an authentication algorithm. For example, create a Get Connection Info (GCI) step with a script that retrieves and stores a one-time token for a REST or SOAP call.

children.name: String
children.text:
Whether the signature is applied to the header, as a query parameter, or as a credential value.

Values include:

  • HEADER: The signature is applied to the request header.
  • QUERY: The signature is applied as a query parameter.
  • CREDENTIAL_VALUE: The signature is applied as a credential value.

children.name: Output
children.text: Signature applied to: HEADER

children.name: Example
children.text: // Define HttpRequestData var endpoint= "https://third-party-endpoint“; var httpRequestData = new sn_auth.HttpRequestData(); httpRequestData.setEndpoint(endpoint); httpRequestData.setService(‘s3’); httpRequestData.setRegion(‘us-east-1’); httpRequestData.setHttpMethod(“PUT”); var content = “Action=SendMessage&MessageBody=This is a test message”; httpRequestData.setContent(content); //Get AuthCredential var credential = new sn_cc.StandardCredentialsProvider().getAuthCredentialByID("5b61c16f73533300f662cff8faf6a74b"); // Create RequestAuthAPI and sign the request var signingAPI = new sn_auth.RequestAuthAPI(httpRequestData, credential); var output = signingAPI.generateAuth(); output.setDirective("header"); gs.info("Signature applied to: " + output.getDirective());

children.name: getDirective()
children.text:
Returns whether the signature is applied to the request in the header, as a query
    parameter, or as a credential value.
children.text2: By default, the system applies the signature to the header. You can apply the signature as a query parameter or credential value by using the setDirective() API.

children.name: Object
children.text:
Key-value pairs that define all of the headers included when the request was signed. Each key-value pair includes these parts:
  • key: String. Name of the header.
  • value: String. Value of the header.

children.name: Output
children.text:
*** Script: [DEBUG] authH:AWS4-HMAC-SHA256 Credential=lsjfljljfllfwek/20191127/us-east-1/s3/aws4_request, 
SignedHeaders=host;x-amz-acl;x-amz-content-sha256;x-amz-date, 
Signature=5c349011324910c34596ba7abbd10e07c4127774049f8953418bd7bed7d02b90 
*** Script: [DEBUG] xamzdateH:20191127T175210Z 
*** Script: [DEBUG] content256:UNSIGNED-PAYLOAD

children.name: Example
children.text: // Define the HttpRequestData object var endpoint= "https://third-party-endpoint"; var httpRequestData = new sn_auth.HttpRequestData(); httpRequestData.setEndpoint(endpoint); httpRequestData.setService(‘s3’); httpRequestData.setRegion(‘us-east-1’); httpRequestData.setHttpMethod(“PUT”); var content = “Action=SendMessage&MessageBody=This is a test message”; httpRequestData.setContent(content); httpRequestData.addHeader(‘x-amz-acl’ , ‘public-read’ ); // Get an AuthCredential object var credential = new sn_cc.StandardCredentialsProvider().getAuthCredentialByID("5b61c16f73533300f662cff8faf6a74b"); // Create the RequestAuthAPI object and sign the request var signingAPI = new sn_auth.RequestAuthAPI(httpRequestData, credential); var output = signingAPI.generateAuth(); // get the signed response detail var authH = headerM["Authorization"]; var xamzdateH = headerM["X-Amz-Date"]; var content256 = headerM["x-amz-content-sha256"]; gs.debug(‘authH:’ + authH ); gs.debug(‘xamzdateH:’ + xamzdateH ); gs.debug(‘content256:’ + content256 );

children.name: getHeaderMap()
children.text:
Returns an object containing the headers that were included when the request was
    signed.

children.name: Object
children.text:
Key-value pairs that define the query parameters included when the request was signed. Each key-value pair includes these parts:
  • key: String. Name of the query parameter.
  • value: String. Value of the query parameter.

children.name: Output
children.text: API Version is: v2

children.name: Example
children.text: // Define the HttpRequestData object var endpoint= "https://third-party-endpoint"; var httpRequestData = new sn_auth.HttpRequestData(); httpRequestData.setEndpoint(endpoint); httpRequestData.setService(‘s3’); httpRequestData.setRegion(‘us-east-1’); httpRequestData.setHttpMethod(“PUT”); var content = “Action=SendMessage&MessageBody=This is a test message”; httpRequestData.setContent(content); httpRequestData.addQueryParam(‘api_version’, ‘v2’ ); httpRequestData.addQueryParam(‘limit’, ‘1000’ ); httpRequestData.addQueryParam(‘offset’, ‘1’ ); // Get an AuthCredential object var credential = new sn_cc.StandardCredentialsProvider().getAuthCredentialByID("5b61c16f73533300f662cff8faf6a74b"); // Create the RequestAuthAPI object and sign the request var signingAPI = new sn_auth.RequestAuthAPI(httpRequestData, credential); var output = signingAPI.generateAuth(); // Get the signed response queryMap = output.getQueryMap(); gs.info("API Version is: " + queryMap["api_version"]);

children.name: getQueryMap()
children.text:
Returns an object containing the query parameters included when the request was
    signed.

children.name: String
children.text:
The status of the request signing.

Possible values:

  • SUCCESS: The system successfully signed the request.
  • FAIL: The system failed to sign the request.
  • SKIPPED: The system skipped signing because the information was incomplete.

children.name: Output
children.text: Status is: SUCCESS

children.name: Example
children.text: // Define the HttpRequestData object var endpoint= "https://third-party-endpoint"; var httpRequestData = new sn_auth.HttpRequestData(); httpRequestData.setEndpoint(endpoint); httpRequestData.setService(‘s3’); httpRequestData.setRegion(‘us-east-1’); httpRequestData.setHttpMethod(“PUT”); var content = “Action=SendMessage&MessageBody=This is a test message”; httpRequestData.setContent(content); // Get an AuthCredential object var credential = new sn_cc.StandardCredentialsProvider().getAuthCredentialByID("5b61c16f73533300f662cff8faf6a74b"); // Create the RequestAuthAPI object and sign the request var signingAPI = new sn_auth.RequestAuthAPI(httpRequestData, credential); var output = signingAPI.generateAuth(); // Get the signed status gs.info("Status is: " + output.getStatus());

children.name: getStatus()
children.text: Returns the status of the request signing.

children.name: Output
children.text: Status message is: credential is not valid.

children.name: Example
children.text: // Define the HttpRequestData object var endpoint= "https://third-party-endpoint"; var httpRequestData = new sn_auth.HttpRequestData(); httpRequestData.setEndpoint(endpoint); httpRequestData.setService(‘s3’); httpRequestData.setRegion(‘us-east-1’); httpRequestData.setHttpMethod(“PUT”); var content = “Action=SendMessage&MessageBody=This is a test message”; httpRequestData.setContent(content); httpRequestData.addQueryParam(‘api_version’, ‘v2’ ); httpRequestData.addQueryParam(‘limit’, ‘1000’ ); httpRequestData.addQueryParam(‘offset’, ‘1’ ); // Get AuthCredential object and set an attribute var credential = new sn_auth.AuthCredential(); credential.setAttribute("user_name", "admin"); credential.setAttribute("password", "admin"); // Create the RequestAuthAPI object and sign the request var signingAPI = new sn_auth.RequestAuthAPI(httpRequestData, credential); var output = signingAPI.generateAuth(); // Get the signed status gs.info("Status message is: " + output.getStatusMessage());

children.name: String
children.text:
Message about the request signing. If the request signing fails, returns one of these error messages:
  • credential is not valid: Check the AuthCredential object you used to sign the request. Make sure an authentication algorithm is associated with the credential. For more information, see Configure an authentication algorithm.
  • Request data is empty. Request auth is skipped: Check the HttpRequestData object because required information may be missing.
  • Can't find script includes scope: Verify that the authentication algorithm record and associated script includes used to sign the request are in the correct scope.

children.name: getStatusMessage()
children.text:
Returns a detailed message about the request signing. If the request signing fails,
    this method returns the error message.

children.name: Example
children.text: var RequestAuthGCISigner = Class.create(); RequestAuthGCISigner.prototype = Object.extend(new RequestAuthInternal(), { initialize: function() { RequestAuthInternal.prototype.initialize.call(this); }, generateAuth: function(authAPI) { var requestData = authAPI.getHttpRequestData(); // get credentials var credential = authAPI.getAuthCredential(); var username = credential.getAttribute("user_name"); var password = credential.getAttribute("password"); var httpRequestSignedData = new sn_auth.HttpRequestAuthedData(); var directive = requestData.getDirective(); var b64data = GlideStringUtil.base64encode(username+":"+password); // set CREDENTIAL_VALUE httpRequestSignedData.setCredentialValue("Basic " + b64data); httpRequestSignedData.setDirective("CREDENTIAL_VALUE"); httpRequestSignedData.setStatus("SUCCESS"); return httpRequestSignedData; }, type: 'RequestAuthGCISigner' });
children.text2: This  shows how to set a credential value for a GCI step.

children.name: credential_value
children.text: String
children.text2: Text of the credential value.

children.name: setCredentialValue(String credential_value)
children.text: Sets a credential value for the HttpRequestAuthedData object.
children.text2:
Use a credential value to store a cookie, signature, or other value needed for an authentication algorithm. For example, create a Get Connection Info (GCI) step with a script that retrieves and stores a one-time token for a REST or SOAP call.

Use the setCredentialValue() method to set the Credential Value data pill for REST, SOAP, and GCI steps in Flow Designer.

children.name: Example
children.text: // Define HttpRequestData var endpoint= "https://third-party-endpoint“; var httpRequestData = new sn_auth.HttpRequestData(); httpRequestData.setEndpoint(endpoint); httpRequestData.setService(‘s3’); httpRequestData.setRegion(‘us-east-1’); httpRequestData.setHttpMethod(“PUT”); var content = “Action=SendMessage&MessageBody=This is a test message”; httpRequestData.setContent(content); //Get AuthCredential var credential = new sn_cc.StandardCredentialsProvider().getAuthCredentialByID("5b61c16f73533300f662cff8faf6a74b"); // Create RequestAuthAPI and sign the request var signingAPI = new sn_auth.RequestAuthAPI(httpRequestData, credential); var output = signingAPI.generateAuth(); output.setDirective("header");

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: directive
children.text: String
children.text2:
Whether to apply the signature to the header, query parameter, or credential value of the signed request.

Values include:

  • query: Applies signature as a query parameter.
  • header: Applies signature to the request header.
  • credential_value: Applies signature to the credential value.

children.name: setDirective(String directive)
children.text:
Defines whether to apply the signature to the signed request in the header, as a query
    parameter, or as a credential value.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: Output
children.text: Status is: FAIL

children.name: Example
children.text: // Define the HttpRequestData object var endpoint= "https://third-party-endpoint"; var httpRequestData = new sn_auth.HttpRequestData(); httpRequestData.setEndpoint(endpoint); httpRequestData.setService(‘s3’); httpRequestData.setRegion(‘us-east-1’); httpRequestData.setHttpMethod(“PUT”); var content = “Action=SendMessage&MessageBody=This is a test message”; httpRequestData.setContent(content); // Get an AuthCredential object var credential = new sn_cc.StandardCredentialsProvider().getAuthCredentialByID("5b61c16f73533300f662cff8faf6a74b"); // Create the RequestAuthAPI object and sign the request var signingAPI = new sn_auth.RequestAuthAPI(httpRequestData, credential); var output = signingAPI.generateAuth(); output.setStatus("fail"); // Get the signed status gs.info("Status is: " + output.getStatus());

children.name: status
children.text: String
children.text2:
The status of the request signing.

Possible values:

  • success: The system successfully signed the request.
  • fail: The system failed to sign the request.
  • skipped: The system skipped signing because the information was incomplete.

children.name: setStatus(String status)
children.text: Sets the status of the request signing.

children.name: Output
children.text: Status message is: The request was successfully signed.

children.name: Example
children.text: // Define the HttpRequestData object var endpoint= "https://third-party-endpoint"; var httpRequestData = new sn_auth.HttpRequestData(); httpRequestData.setEndpoint(endpoint); httpRequestData.setService(‘s3’); httpRequestData.setRegion(‘us-east-1’); httpRequestData.setHttpMethod(“PUT”); var content = “Action=SendMessage&MessageBody=This is a test message”; httpRequestData.setContent(content); // Get an AuthCredential object var credential = new sn_cc.StandardCredentialsProvider().getAuthCredentialByID("5b61c16f73533300f662cff8faf6a74b"); // Create the RequestAuthAPI object and sign the request var signingAPI = new sn_auth.RequestAuthAPI(httpRequestData, credential); var output = signingAPI.generateAuth(); output.setStatusMessage("The request was successfully signed."); // Get the signed status message gs.info("Status message is: " + output.getStatusMessage());

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: statusMessage
children.text: String
children.text2: Message to set for the request signing status.

children.name: setStatusMessage(String statusMessage)
children.text: Sets a status message for the request signing.

name: HttpRequestAuthedData
text: The HttpRequestAuthedData() API provides methods to access and set values in a signed REST or SOAP request.
text2:
Generate outbound signing requests using these APIs in the following order:
  1. HttpRequestData: Build the API request.
  2. AuthCredential: Create a credential object or update an existing one. Use the credential to sign the request through the RequestAuthAPI class.
  3. RequestAuthAPI: Sign the request and return an HttpRequestAuthedData object.
  4. HttpRequestAuthedData: Get information about the signed request.
  5. GlideHTTPRequest: Send the signed request.


Before using these APIs, you must configure an authentication algorithm to sign the request and associate it with the credential used to authenticate the request.

Use this API in scoped scripts with the sn_auth namespace identifier. You can instantiate this class using the constructor, or you can return an HttpRequestAuthedData object from the generateAuth() method in the RequestAuthAPI class.

children.name: Example
children.text: var httpRequestData = new sn_auth.HttpRequestData();

children.name: HttpRequestData()
children.text: Instantiates an HttpRequestData object.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: key
children.text: String
children.text2: Name of the HTTP header.

children.name: Example
children.text: var endpoint= "https://s3.amazonaws.com"; var httpRequestData = new sn_auth.HttpRequestData(); httpRequestData.setEndpoint(endpoint); httpRequestData.setService('s3'); httpRequestData.setRegion('us-east-1'); httpRequestData.setHttpMethod("PUT"); var content = "Action=SendMessage&MessageBody=This is a test message"; httpRequestData.setContent(content); httpRequestData.addHeader('x-amz-acl', 'public-read' );
children.text2: This  creates a REST request payload.

children.name: value
children.text: String
children.text2: Value of the HTTP Header.

children.name: addHeader(String key String value)
children.text: Adds a header to the HttpRequestData object.

children.name: key
children.text: String
children.text2: Name of the query parameter.

children.name: Example
children.text: var endpoint= "https://third-party-endpoint"; var httpRequestData = new sn_auth.HttpRequestData(); httpRequestData.setEndpoint(endpoint); httpRequestData.setService('s3'); httpRequestData.setRegion('us-east-1'); httpRequestData.setHttpMethod('put'); var content = "Action=SendMessage&MessageBody=This is a test message"; httpRequestData.setContent(content); httpRequestData.addQueryParam('api_version', 'v2 ); ​

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: value
children.text: String
children.text2: Value of the query parameter.

children.name: addQueryParam(String key, String value)
children.text: Adds a query parameter to the HttpRequestData object.

children.name: Example
children.text: var endpoint= "https://s3.amazonaws.com"; var httpRequestData = new sn_auth.HttpRequestData(); httpRequestData.setEndpoint(endpoint); httpRequestData.setService('s3'); httpRequestData.setRegion('us-east-1'); httpRequestData.setHttpMethod('put'); var content = "Action=SendMessage&MessageBody=This is a test message"; httpRequestData.setContent(content); httpRequestData.deleteHeader('x-amz-acl');

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: key
children.text: String
children.text2: Name of the HTTP header to remove.

children.name: deleteHeader(String key)
children.text: Removes a header from the HttpRequestData object.

children.name: Example
children.text: var httpRequestData = new sn_auth.HttpRequestData(); var id = httpRequestData.getConnectionAliasID(); var credential = new sn_cc.ConnectionInfoProvider(). var connectionInfo = credential.getConnectionInfo(id);

children.name: String
children.text:
Sys_id of the alias record from the Connection & Credential Aliases
                [sys_alias] table associated with the request.

children.name: getConnectionAliasID()
children.text: Returns the sys_id of the Connection & Credential alias associated with the Integration Hub REST step.
children.text2:
You can pass the sys_id to the ConnectionInfoProvider API to retrieve information about the connection.

Note: You can only use this method in an Integration Hub REST step. For more information, see REST step.

children.name: name
children.text: String
children.text2: Name of the connection attribute.

children.name: Example
children.text: var httpRequestData = new sn_auth.HttpRequestData();​ gs.info("API Version is: " + httpRequestData.getConnectionExtendedAttribute('api_version'));
children.text2:
This  returns the value of a connection attribute set on the Connection &
        Credential alias associated with the REST step.

children.name: String
children.text: Value of the connection attribute.

children.name: getConnectionExtendedAttribute(String name)
children.text: Returns the value of a connection attribute associated with the Connection & Credential alias associated with Integration Hub REST step.
children.text2:
Note: You can only use this method in an Integration Hub REST step. For more information, see REST step.

For more information about connection attributes, see Create connection attributes for IntegrationHub.

children.name: Output
children.text: Action=SendMessage&MessageBody=This is a test message

children.name: Example
children.text: var endpoint= "https://s3.amazonaws.com“; var httpRequestData = new sn_auth.HttpRequestData(); httpRequestData.setEndpoint(endpoint); httpRequestData.setService('s3'); httpRequestData.setRegion('us-east-1'); httpRequestData.setHttpMethod('put'); var content = “Action=SendMessage&MessageBody=This is a test message”; httpRequestData.setContent(content); httpRequestData.addHeader(‘x-amz-acl’ , ‘public-read’ ); var ct = httpRequestData.getContent();

children.name: String
children.text: Content of the request.

children.name: getContent()
children.text: Returns the content of the request in the HttpRequestData object.

children.name: Example
children.text: var endpoint= "https://s3.amazonaws.com";​ var httpRequestData = new sn_auth.HttpRequestData();​ httpRequestData.setEndpoint(endpoint);​ httpRequestData.addQueryParam("list-type", "2");​ httpRequestData.setService('s3');​ httpRequestData.setHttpMethod('get');​ gs.info( "Date: " + httpRequestData.getDate());

children.name: Number
children.text:
The difference between January 1, 1970 UTC and when the request was signed.

Unit: Milliseconds

children.name: getDate()
children.text: Returns the date when the request was signed.

children.name: Output
children.text: Signature applied to: HEADER

children.name: Example
children.text: var endpoint= "https://s3.amazonaws.com“;​ var httpRequestData = new sn_auth.HttpRequestData();​ httpRequestData.setEndpoint(endpoint);​ httpRequestData.addQueryParam("list-type", "2");​ httpRequestData.setService('s3');​ httpRequestData.setHttpMethod('get');​ gs.info( "Signature applied to: " + httpRequestData.getDirective() );

children.name: String
children.text:
Whether the signature is applied to the header or as a query parameter.

Values include:

  • HEADER: The signature is applied to the request header.
  • QUERY: The signature is applied as a query parameter.

children.name: getDirective()
children.text:
Returns whether the signature is applied to the request in the header or as a query
    parameter.
children.text2: By default, the system applies the signature to the header. You can apply the signature as a query parameter using the setDirective() API.

children.name: Output
children.text: Endpoint is: https://s3.amazonaws.com

children.name: Example
children.text: var endpoint= "https://s3.amazonaws.com";​ var httpRequestData = new sn_auth.HttpRequestData();​ httpRequestData.setEndpoint(endpoint);​ httpRequestData.addQueryParam("list-type", "2");​ httpRequestData.setService('s3');​ httpRequestData.setHttpMethod('get');​ httpRequestData.setDirective("query");​ ​ gs.info( "Endpoint is: " + httpRequestData.getEndpoint() );

children.name: String
children.text: Endpoint set for the request.

children.name: getEndpoint()
children.text: Returns the endpoint set for the request.

children.name: Output
children.text: Signature expires in: 300

children.name: Example
children.text: var endpoint= "https://s3.amazonaws.com";​ var httpRequestData = new sn_auth.HttpRequestData();​ httpRequestData.setEndpoint(endpoint);​ httpRequestData.addQueryParam("list-type", "2");​ httpRequestData.setService('s3');​ httpRequestData.setHttpMethod('get');​ httpRequestData.setDirective("query");​ httpRequestData.setExpiry(300); gs.info("Signature expires in: " + httpRequestData.getExpiry());

children.name: Number
children.text:
Time before the signature expires.

Unit: Seconds

children.name: getExpiry()
children.text: Returns the time in seconds before the signature expires starting when the request was signed using the generateAuth() method in the RequestAuthAPI class.
children.text2: The expiration is commonly set by the third-party service you are sending the request to, which overrides any value set by the setExpiry() method. For example, if the expiration is set to 900 seconds by the third-party service and you use the setExpiry() method to set the expiration to 300 seconds, the getExpiry() method returns 900 seconds.

children.name: Output
children.text: Header value is: public-read

children.name: Example
children.text: var endpoint= "https://third-party-endpoint"; var httpRequestData = new sn_auth.HttpRequestData(); httpRequestData.setEndpoint(endpoint); httpRequestData.setService('s3'); httpRequestData.setRegion('us-east-1'); httpRequestData.setHttpMethod('put'); var content = "Action=SendMessage&MessageBody=This is a test message"; httpRequestData.setContent(content); httpRequestData.addHeader(‘x-amz-acl’, ‘public-read’ ); ​ gs.info( "Header value is: " + httpRequestData.getHeader(‘x-amz-acl’) );

children.name: String
children.text: Value of the given HTTP header.

children.name: key
children.text: String
children.text2: Name of HTTP header.

children.name: getHeader(String key)
children.text: Returns the value associated with the given HTTP header.

children.name: Output
children.text:
*** Script: x-amz-acl
*** Script: content-type

children.name: Example
children.text: var endpoint= "https://third-party-endpoint"; var httpRequestData = new sn_auth.HttpRequestData(); httpRequestData.setEndpoint(endpoint); httpRequestData.setService('s3'); httpRequestData.setRegion('us-east-1'); httpRequestData.setHttpMethod('put'); var content = "Action=SendMessage&MessageBody=This is a test message"; httpRequestData.setContent(content); httpRequestData.addHeader(‘x-amz-acl’, ‘public-read’ ); httpRequestData.addHeader(‘content-type’, ‘application/json’ ); var map = httpRequestData.getHeaderMap(); for(var x in map) { var y = map[x] gs.info(x, y); }

children.name: Object
children.text:
Key-value pairs that define all of the headers associated with the request.

Each key-value pair includes these parts:

  • Key: String. Name of the header.
  • Value: String. Value of the header.

children.name: getHeaderMap()
children.text: Returns an object containing the headers included in the request.

children.name: Output
children.text: Host is: myHost

children.name: Example
children.text: var endpoint= "https://third-party-endpoint“; var httpRequestData = new sn_auth.HttpRequestData(); httpRequestData.setEndpoint(endpoint); httpRequestData.setHost('myHost') httpRequestData.setService('s3'); httpRequestData.setRegion('us-east-1'); httpRequestData.setHttpMethod('put'); var content = “Action=SendMessage&MessageBody=This is a test message”; httpRequestData.setContent(content); httpRequestData.addHeader(‘x-amz-acl’ , ‘public-read’ ); gs.info("Host is: " + httpRequestData.getHost());

children.name: String
children.text: Host used in the request.

children.name: getHost()
children.text: Returns the host used in the request.

children.name: Output
children.text: HTTP method is: PUT

children.name: Example
children.text: var endpoint= "https://third-party-endpoint"; var httpRequestData = new sn_auth.HttpRequestData(); httpRequestData.setEndpoint(endpoint); httpRequestData.setService('s3'); httpRequestData.setRegion('us-east-1'); httpRequestData.setHttpMethod('put'); var content = "Action=SendMessage&MessageBody=This is a test message"; httpRequestData.setContent(content); httpRequestData.addHeader(‘x-amz-acl’, ‘public-read’ ); ​ gs.info("HTTP method is: " + httpRequestData.getHttpMethod());

children.name: String
children.text: HTTP method used in the request.

children.name: getHttpMethod()
children.text: Returns the HTTP method used in the request.

children.name: String
children.text: Value of the query parameter.

children.name: key
children.text: String
children.text2: Name of the query parameter to get the value of.

children.name: Output
children.text: API version is: v2

children.name: Example
children.text: var endpoint= "https://third-party-endpoint"; var httpRequestData = new sn_auth.HttpRequestData(); httpRequestData.setEndpoint(endpoint); httpRequestData.setService('s3'); httpRequestData.setRegion('us-east-1'); httpRequestData.setHttpMethod('put'); var content = "Action=SendMessage&MessageBody=This is a test message"; httpRequestData.setContent(content); httpRequestData.addQueryParam(‘api_version’, ‘v2’ ); gs.info("API version is: " + httpRequestData.getQueryParam('api_version'));

children.name: getQueryParam(String key)
children.text: Returns the value of the specified query parameter.

children.name: Output
children.text: api_version is: v2

children.name: Example
children.text: var endpoint= "https://third-party-endpoint"; var httpRequestData = new sn_auth.HttpRequestData(); httpRequestData.setEndpoint(endpoint); httpRequestData.setService('s3'); httpRequestData.setRegion('us-east-1'); httpRequestData.setHttpMethod('put'); var content = "Action=SendMessage&MessageBody=This is a test message"; httpRequestData.setContent(content); httpRequestData.addQueryParam(‘api_version’, ‘v2’ ); httpRequestData.addQueryParam(‘limit’, ‘1000’ ); httpRequestData.addQueryParam(‘offset’, ‘1’ ); var map = httpRequestData.getQueryParamMap(); gs.info("api_version is: " + map['api_version']);

children.name: Object
children.text:
Key-value pairs that define the query parameters associated with the request.

Each key-value pair includes these parts:

  • Key: String. Name of the query parameter.
  • Value: String. Value of the query parameter.

children.name: getQueryParamMap()
children.text: Returns an object containing the query parameters included in the request.

children.name: Output
children.text: Region is: us-east-1

children.name: Example
children.text: var endpoint= "https://third-party-endpoint"; var httpRequestData = new sn_auth.HttpRequestData(); httpRequestData.setEndpoint(endpoint); httpRequestData.setService('s3'); httpRequestData.setRegion('us-east-1'); httpRequestData.setHttpMethod('put'); var content = "Action=SendMessage&MessageBody=This is a test message"; httpRequestData.setContent(content); gs.info("Region is: " + httpRequestData.getRegion());

children.name: String
children.text: Name of the region.

children.name: getRegion()
children.text: Returns the region for the request that will be used in signing.

children.name: Output
children.text: Service is: s3

children.name: Example
children.text: var endpoint= "https://s3.amazonaws.com“; var httpRequestData = new sn_auth.HttpRequestData(); httpRequestData.setEndpoint(endpoint); httpRequestData.setService(‘s3’); gs.info("Service is: " + httpRequestData.getService());

children.name: String
children.text: Service defined in the request.

children.name: getService()
children.text: Returns the service defined in the request.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: content
children.text: String
children.text2: Content to send in the request.

children.name: Example
children.text: var endpoint= "https://s3.amazonaws.com“; var httpRequestData = new sn_auth.HttpRequestData(); httpRequestData.setEndpoint(endpoint); httpRequestData.setService('s3'); httpRequestData.setRegion('us-east-1'); httpRequestData.setHttpMethod('put'); var content = “This is a test message”; httpRequestData.setContent(content);

children.name: setContent(String content)
children.text: Defines the content to send in the request.
children.text2: Note: This method is not supported in script includes or MID server scripts.

children.name: date
children.text: Number
children.text2:
The difference between January 1, 1970 UTC and the date used to sign the request.

Unit: Milliseconds

children.name: Example
children.text: var endpoint= "https://s3.amazonaws.com";​ var httpRequestData = new sn_auth.HttpRequestData();​ httpRequestData.setEndpoint(endpoint);​ httpRequestData.addQueryParam("list-type", "2");​ httpRequestData.setService('s3');​ httpRequestData.setHttpMethod('get'); httpRequestData.setDate(1349333576093);

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: setDate(Number date)
children.text: Defines the date of the request used for signing.
children.text2: Use this method only when testing whether the signature is created correctly based on a time stamp. In production, the signing request uses the time that you generated the signature; manually setting this value may cause the signing request to fail.

children.name: Example
children.text: var endpoint= "https://s3.amazonaws.com“;​ var httpRequestData = new sn_auth.HttpRequestData();​ httpRequestData.setEndpoint(endpoint);​ httpRequestData.addQueryParam("list-type", "2");​ httpRequestData.setService('s3');​ httpRequestData.setHttpMethod('get');​ httpRequestData.setDirective("query");​

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: directive
children.text: String
children.text2:
Whether to apply the signature to the header or as a query parameter.

Values include:

  • query: Applies signature as a query parameter.
  • header: Applies signature to the request header.

Default: header

children.name: setDirective(String directive)
children.text:
Defines whether to apply the signature to the request in a header or as a query
    parameter.

children.name: Example
children.text: var endpoint="https://third-party-endpoint/path-parameters/version"; var httpRequestData = new sn_auth.HttpRequestData(); httpRequestData.setEndpoint(endpoint);

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: endpoint
children.text: String
children.text2:
Endpoint to send the request to. The endpoint can include query parameters,
                path, and version.

children.name: setEndpoint(String endpoint)
children.text: Defines the endpoint to send the request to.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: expiry
children.text: Number
children.text2:
Amount of time before the signature expires.

Unit: Seconds

children.name: Example
children.text: var endpoint= "https://s3.amazonaws.com“;​ var httpRequestData = new sn_auth.HttpRequestData();​ httpRequestData.setEndpoint(endpoint);​ httpRequestData.addQueryParam("list-type", "2");​ httpRequestData.setService('s3');​ httpRequestData.setHttpMethod('get');​ httpRequestData.setExpiry(300);​

children.name: setExpiry(Number expiry)
children.text: Sets the amount of time before the signature expires starting when the request is signed using the generateAuth() method in the RequestAuthAPI class.
children.text2: The expiration is commonly set by the third-party service you are sending the request to, which overrides any value set by the setExpiry() method. For example, if the expiration is set to 900 seconds by the third-party service and you use the setExpiry() method to set the expiration to 300 seconds, the getExpiry() method returns 900 seconds.

children.name: host
children.text: String
children.text2: Name of the HTTP request host.

children.name: Example
children.text: var endpoint= "https:third-party-endpoint“; var httpRequestData = new sn_auth.HttpRequestData(); httpRequestData.setEndpoint(endpoint); httpRequestData.setHost('myHost') httpRequestData.setService('s3'); httpRequestData.setRegion('us-east-1'); httpRequestData.setHttpMethod('put'); var content = “Action=SendMessage&MessageBody=This is a test message”; httpRequestData.setContent(content); httpRequestData.addHeader(‘x-amz-acl’, ‘public-read’ );

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: setHost(String host)
children.text: Defines the host used in the request.

children.name: Example
children.text: var endpoint= "https://third-party-endpoint"; var httpRequestData = new sn_auth.HttpRequestData(); httpRequestData.setEndpoint(endpoint); httpRequestData.setService('s3'); httpRequestData.setRegion('us-east-1'); httpRequestData.setHttpMethod('put');

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: httpMethod
children.text: String
children.text2: HTTP method to use in the request.

children.name: setHttpMethod(String httpMethod)
children.text: Sets the HTTP method to use in the request.

children.name: Example
children.text: var endpoint= "https:third-party-endpoint"; var httpRequestData = new sn_auth.HttpRequestData(); httpRequestData.setEndpoint(endpoint); httpRequestData.setService('s3'); httpRequestData.setRegion('us-east-1'); httpRequestData.setHttpMethod('put'); var content = "Action=SendMessage&MessageBody=This is a test message"; httpRequestData.setContent(content);

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: region
children.text: String
children.text2:
The region to use to sign the request. Available values are determined by the
                third-party API's requirements.

children.name: setRegion(String region)
children.text: Defines the region to use for the request in signing.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: service
children.text: String
children.text2: The service for the request.

children.name: Example
children.text: var endpoint= "https://s3.amazonaws.com“; var httpRequestData = new sn_auth.HttpRequestData(); httpRequestData.setEndpoint(endpoint); httpRequestData.setService(‘s3’);

children.name: setService(String service)
children.text: Defines the service for the request.

name: HttpRequestData
text: The HttpRequestData API provides methods to build and manipulate a REST request before applying a signature and sending it to an endpoint.
text2:
Generate outbound signing requests using these APIs in the following order:
  1. HttpRequestData: Build the API request.
  2. AuthCredential: Create a credential object or update an existing one. Use the credential to sign the request through the RequestAuthAPI class.
  3. RequestAuthAPI: Sign the request and return an HttpRequestAuthedData object.
  4. HttpRequestAuthedData: Get information about the signed request.
  5. GlideHTTPRequest: Send the signed request.


Before using these APIs, you must configure an authentication algorithm to sign the request and associate it with the credential used to authenticate the request.

Use this API in scoped scripts with the sn_auth namespace identifier. You can instantiate this class using the constructor, or you can return an HttpRequestData object from the getHttpRequestData() method in the RequestAuthAPI class.

children.name: data
children.text: Object
children.text2: HttpRequestData object that contains the unsigned REST request. Use the HttpRequestData class to build this object. See HttpRequestData API.

children.name: Example
children.text: // Define the HttpRequestData object var endpoint= "https://third-party-endpoint"; var httpRequestData = new sn_auth.HttpRequestData(); httpRequestData.setEndpoint(endpoint); httpRequestData.setService(‘s3’); httpRequestData.setRegion(‘us-east-1’); httpRequestData.setHttpMethod(“PUT”); var content = “Action=SendMessage&MessageBody=This is a test message”; httpRequestData.setContent(content); httpRequestData.addHeader(‘x-amz-acl’ , ‘public-read’ ); // Get a credential record var credential = new sn_cc.StandardCredentialsProvider().getAuthCredentialByID("88772d0d40990010f8772fdd9ebc8075"); // Instantiate a RequestAuthAPI object var signingAPI = new sn_auth.RequestAuthAPI(httpRequestData, credential);

children.name: credential
children.text: Object
children.text2: Object that represents a record from the Credentials [discovery_credentials] table. Retrieve this object using the AuthCredential class. See AuthCredential API.

children.name: RequestAuthAPI(Object data, Object credential)
children.text: Instantiates a RequestAuthAPI object using a REST request and a credential.

children.name: Example
children.text: // Define the HttpRequestData object var endpoint= "https://third-party-endpoint"; var httpRequestData = new sn_auth.HttpRequestData(); httpRequestData.setEndpoint(endpoint); httpRequestData.setService(‘s3’); httpRequestData.setRegion(‘us-east-1’); httpRequestData.setHttpMethod(“PUT”); var content = “Action=SendMessage&MessageBody=This is a test message”; httpRequestData.setContent(content); httpRequestData.addHeader(‘x-amz-acl’ , ‘public-read’ ); // Get a credential record gs.info( “date:” + httpRequestData.getDate() ); var credential = new sn_cc.StandardCredentialsProvider().getAuthCredentialByID("5b61c16f73533300f662cff8faf6a74b"); // Create the RequestAuthAPI object and sign the request var signingAPI = new sn_auth.RequestAuthAPI(httpRequestData, credential); var output = signingAPI.generateAuth();
children.text2: This creates a request and gets a credential record to pass to the RequestAuthAPI API. The generateAuth() method then signs the request.

children.name: HttpRequestAuthedData
children.text: Object. Data to use to obtain information about the signed result. Use the methods in the HttpRequestAuthedData class to interact with the signed result. See HttpRequestAuthedData API.

children.name: generateAuth()
children.text:
Signs the HttpRequestData object and returns an HttpRequestAuthedData object to use to
    send in the REST request.

children.name: Example
children.text: // Define the HttpRequestData object var endpoint= "https://third-party-endpoint“; var httpRequestData = new sn_auth.HttpRequestData(); httpRequestData.setEndpoint(endpoint); httpRequestData.setService(‘s3’); httpRequestData.setRegion(‘us-east-1’); httpRequestData.setHttpMethod(“PUT”); var content = “Action=SendMessage&MessageBody=This is a test message”; httpRequestData.setContent(content); httpRequestData.addHeader(‘x-amz-acl’ , ‘public-read’ ); // Get a credential record var credential = new sn_cc.StandardCredentialsProvider().getAuthCredentialByID("5b61c16f73533300f662cff8faf6a74b"); // Return the AuthCredential object var signingAPI = new sn_auth.RequestAuthAPI(httpRequestData, credential); var signingCredential = signingAPI.getAuthCredential();

children.name: AuthCredential
children.text: Object. Data to use to obtain information about the credential record used to sign the request. Use the methods in the AuthCredential class to interact with the credential. See AuthCredential API.

children.name: getAuthCredential()
children.text: Returns the credential record used to sign the request.

children.name: Output
children.text: Endpoint is: https://third-party-endpoint

children.name: Example
children.text: // Define the HttpRequestData object var endpoint= "https://third-party-endpoint"; var httpRequestData = new sn_auth.HttpRequestData(); httpRequestData.setEndpoint(endpoint); httpRequestData.setService(‘s3’); httpRequestData.setRegion(‘us-east-1’); httpRequestData.setHttpMethod(“PUT”); var content = “Action=SendMessage&MessageBody=This is a test message”; httpRequestData.setContent(content); httpRequestData.addHeader(‘x-amz-acl’ , ‘public-read’ ); // Get a credential record var credential = new sn_cc.StandardCredentialsProvider().getAuthCredentialByID("88772d0d40990010f8772fdd9ebc8075"); // Return the HttpRequestData object var signingAPI = new sn_auth.RequestAuthAPI(httpRequestData, credential); var unsignedRequest = signingAPI.getHttpRequestData(); gs.info("Endpoint is: " + unsignedRequest.getEndpoint());

children.name: HttpRequestData
children.text: Object. Contains the unsigned REST request. Use the methods in the HttpRequestData class to interact with the request. See HttpRequestData API.

children.name: getHttpRequestData()
children.text: Returns the HttpRequestData object that was used to instantiate the RequestAuthAPI class.

children.name: Example
children.text: // Creates a temporary token function(authAPI) {​ var requestData = authAPI.getHttpRequestData();​ var credential= authAPI.getAuthCredential();​ credential.setAttribute('Action', 'aws_sessionToken');​ authAPI.resetAuthCredential(); //Returns status information var status = credential.getAttribute(‘credential_reset_status’); ​ }

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: resetAuthCredential()
children.text:
Generates a temporary, limited privilege token that you can use to provide trusted
    users with temporary security credentials to control third-party resources.
children.text2: To use this method, the third-party service must include an API or SDK that processes and manages limited access tokens.

name: RequestAuthAPI
text: The RequestAuthAPI() API provides methods to apply a signature to a REST request.
text2:
Generate outbound signing requests using these APIs in the following order:
  1. HttpRequestData: Build the API request.
  2. AuthCredential: Create a credential object or update an existing one. Use the credential to sign the request through the RequestAuthAPI class.
  3. RequestAuthAPI: Sign the request and return an HttpRequestAuthedData object.
  4. HttpRequestAuthedData: Get information about the signed request.
  5. GlideHTTPRequest: Send the signed request.


Before using these APIs, you must configure an authentication algorithm to sign the request and associate it with the credential used to authenticate the request.

Use this API in scoped scripts with the sn_auth namespace identifier.
